channel.title: Runing a java program using internet explorer browser
channel.description: Lets take a simple hi java program how can i use internet explorer to run that file rather than jpad pro or anyother development pad

item.title: Runing a java program using internet explorer browser
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Well you don’t need to use a jar file if you don’t want to…just convert your project into an applet (you’ll have you use a basic…not just System.out.println()). Here’s a nice tutorial: http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/uiswing/components/applet.html

Read full topic
item.source: Runing a java program using internet explorer browser

item.title: Runing a java program using internet explorer browser
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Well, that doesn’t run it in IE, but…
Instead of putting the <object…> in your .java…
You can make a .html file with it in it (Along with all of the doo dads needed for an HTML document).

item.source: Runing a java program using internet explorer browser

item.title: Runing a java program using internet explorer browser
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Make your program extend the Applet class.

And put this dandy set of code at the top:

//THis bit after this is for the applet size, ect.. So you can run the applet by itself. /* <object code="ClassName" width=200 height=50> </object> */
Then your run.bat should be:

@echo off appletviewer ClassName.java pause

Read full topic
